meanings.definition: To make a new master copy of (a recording) in order to improve the sound quality.
meanings.sent1: The audio engineer remasters the old song to make it sound better.
meanings.sent2: She always remasters the classic albums to enhance the audio quality.
meanings.sent3: The musician joked that he could remaster his cat's meows to create a hit song.
meanings.sent4: The artist's skill in remastering music is like turning a dull stone into a sparkling gem.
meanings.sent5: The process of remastering the film made the dialogue clearer and the music more vibrant.

meanings.definition: A new master copy of a recording made in order to improve the sound quality.
meanings.sent1: The remasters of the old albums are selling well among audiophiles.
meanings.sent2: He collected rare remasters of famous songs from the 80s.
meanings.sent3: The studio proudly displayed the remasters of the classic records on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The remasters of the songs were like rediscovering lost treasures in a dusty attic.
meanings.sent5: The remasters of the concert recordings brought out details that were previously unheard.
